page.title: 16SHELTERED ACCOMMODATION
page.content: In November,1983, Councillor Davies opened{sheltered accommodation}for people in Hebburn. There are 27 flats with one front door and 4 separate bungalows. There is an{intercom } system for safety. A{warden}lives there too and she helps to organize parties, bingo and other entertainments. Every room in the building has an{emergency cord}which alerts the warden who can call a doctor. There are{two lounges}for the residents and a{laundry}with washers and dryers. The residents must be able to look after themselves as it is not a nursing home. Often their families visit and help out. The corridors have{handrails}on both sides to help the shakier walkers; the oldest resident is 88. The residents are very happy here but cannot keep pets except for budgies.
